name: consolingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes or is intended to make someone feel better when they are sad or disappointed: "You've done very well," they said consolingly.
More examplesFewer examplesHer brother patted her arm consolingly."It's no good," John says, and adds consolingly: "It's beautifully written, but it's too literary."Adele saw Isabel's pale face turn even whiter and broke off, patting her hand consolingly. Anne said consolingly to Sarah, "Maybe the war will be over soon anyway."
